docs.text: Welcome to The Man of the Gun Discover The Man of the Gun , a dark and gritty narrative-driven action game set in a world torn apart by chaos. Follow Clayton Harrow, a bureaucrat caught in the enigmatic power of the Soul Communication Network (SCN), as he struggles to uncover the truth behind the forces manipulating humanity. Explore the depths of this twisted world, experience brutal combat, and immerse yourself in a philosophical journey like no other.

docs.text: Meet the Characters Clayton Harrow A middle-aged bureaucrat lost in a world that no longer values him. Haunted by his past and uncertain about his future, Clayton is thrust into a brutal struggle with the Soul Communication Network. Shiniza Yakavaze Shiniza Yakavaze is a deformed, wheelchair-bound villain with one working arm, brandishing a pistol. Once a powerful figure in the realm of the SCN (Soul Communication Network), his physical state is a direct result of his deep entanglement with the SCN. Despite his fragile appearance, Shiniza remains one of the most formidable foes in the universe of The Man of The Gun . His power within the SCN allows him to manipulate reality, bending the minds of those around him and questioning the very fabric of existence. His deformations serve as a stark reminder of the toll the SCN exacts on those who dare to manipulate it. Will you be able to withstand the mental and physical onslaught of this reality-bending antagonist, or will you succumb to the same fate as so many before you? Kettleback Kettleback is an ancient, frail figure whose hunched back curves unnaturally as he shuffles slowly across the decaying ground. His weathered hands clutch a worn-out teapot, its steam rising faintly as if it's the last warm thing in his cold existence. Once a revered philosopher in the realms of the Soul Communication Network (SCN), Kettleback paid the price for bending reality and manipulating the forces beyond nature. Now, he is a twisted reflection of his former self, both in body and mind. As you approach, his eerie, crackling laughter echoes through the void, and with every step, the teapot spills reality-warping drops that distort time and space around you. Be wary, for behind the frailty lies unimaginable power. History of The Dining Philosophers The Dining Philosophers are an enigmatic, secretive group in The Man of The Gun universe, deeply tied to the manipulation of the Soul Communication Network (SCN). These influential figures control the flow of ideas, emotions, and health, ensuring that society functions under their hidden influence. They believe that only by regulating the SCN can humanity avoid chaos, but their actions come at the cost of individual freedom and well-being. Serving as gatekeepers of reality, the Dining Philosophers represent a twisted form of intellectual tyranny, and those who meddle in their affairs often face horrific consequences, both physical and mental. Ashkaboos Ashkaboos is not a tyrant, not a dictator, nor a madman seeking control for personal gain. He sees himself as a living martyr, a necessary force in a world doomed to destruction by humanity’s own desires. His role in the Soul Communication Network (SCN) is not one of choice, but of duty. He carries the weight of responsibility, knowing that without the SCN, humanity would descend into chaos. In Ashkaboos’s eyes, the SCN is not a curse, but a refining process—one that strengthens the strong and purges the weak. He doesn’t seek power; he believes he has none. He is merely the caretaker, a servant of the Dining Philosophers, bound to protect the fragile system that holds reality together. Though calm and authoritative, Ashkaboos is not without weariness. Every action he takes, every life he manipulates, weighs heavily on him. He is not without compassion—he simply believes that without his intervention, the world would destroy itself. His vision of control is not about domination; it’s about survival. As he often says, “This is not cruelty. It is mercy.” The SCN was broken long before Ashkaboos came to it. He sees himself as the only one capable of holding it together, even if it means being seen as the villain. He doesn't relish the title, but he accepts it as the price for keeping humanity from tearing itself apart. Ashkaboos’s ultimate goal is not control or power, but balance—a balance that he alone can provide through the SCN. Seamus O'Driscoll Seamus O'Driscoll is a weary, broken man who once walked in the light but now lives in the shadows of regret. His wisdom comes at a great cost, both to his body and his soul. Once a vibrant figure, Seamus has been worn down by years of exposure to the Soul Communication Network (SCN), the invisible web that connects all living beings on a level far deeper than technology. Now, he spends his final days in a crumbling cabin on the edge of a dying city, clinging to the faint warmth of a fire and a half-empty glass of whiskey. Seamus’s relationship with the SCN is complicated—both a curse and a gift. He knows its depths better than anyone, having touched its core and seen what it can do to those who delve too deeply. The SCN has taken pieces of him, leaving him frail and haunted by the loss of countless souls he’s witnessed crumble under its weight. Yet, Seamus understands that it is also a powerful tool, one that, if used wisely, can offer salvation. His mentorship of Clayton Harrow is driven by this dual understanding: to warn him of the SCN's dangers while encouraging him to harness its potential. With a thick Irish accent and a voice heavy with sorrow, Seamus speaks as if every word could be his last. His teachings are filled with allegory, often referencing ancient wisdom passed down from the "old ones," who once spoke of the SCN in hushed tones as if it were folklore. But Seamus knows better—it’s no myth. It’s real, and it’s deadly. Despite his somber demeanor, there’s a deep affection between Seamus and Clayton. Seamus does not want to see the same fate befall his protégé that claimed so many before him. His plea to Clayton is simple but heartfelt: “Use it wisely, lad. The SCN is the power to change, but also the power to destroy.”

docs.text: The Story of The Man of the Gun In a world where technology has seeped into the very fabric of human existence, Clayton Harrow finds himself at the crossroads of chaos and order. The Soul Communication Network (SCN) governs everything, connecting humanity in ways never thought possible, but it also controls minds, bodies, and souls. As Clayton navigates through this dystopian landscape, he will face enemies both external and internal, uncovering the dark secrets of the SCN and the Dining Philosophers who wield power over it. Will Clayton find freedom, or will he succumb to the manipulation of forces far beyond his control?
